name: bet
author: FMRIB Analysis Group, University of Oxford
description: Automated brain extraction tool for FSL

inputs.name: Input file

inputs.description: Output brain mask (e.g. img_bet.nii.gz)
inputs.name: Mask file

inputs.description: Fractional intensity threshold (0->1); default=0.5; smaller values give larger brain outline estimates
inputs.name: Fractional intensity threshold

inputs.description: Vertical gradient in fractional intensity threshold (-1->1); default=0; positive values give larger brain outline at bottom, smaller at top
inputs.name: Vertical gradient fractional intensity threshold

inputs.description: The xyz coordinates of the center of gravity (voxels, not mm) of initial mesh surface. Must have exactly three numerical entries in the list (3-vector).
inputs.name: Center of gravity vector

inputs.description: Generate brain surface outline overlaid onto original image
inputs.name: Overlay flag

inputs.description: Generate binary brain mask
inputs.name: Binary mask flag

inputs.description: Generate rough skull image (not as clean as betsurf)
inputs.name: Approximate skull flag

inputs.description: Don't generate segmented brain image output
inputs.name: No segmented brain image flag

inputs.description: Generate brain surface as mesh in .vtk format
inputs.name: VTK format brain surface mesh flag

inputs.description: head radius (mm not voxels); initial surface sphere is set to half of this
inputs.name: Head Radius

inputs.description: Apply thresholding to segmented brain image and mask
inputs.name: Threshold segmented image flag

inputs.description: More robust brain center estimation, by iterating BET with a changing center-of-gravity.
inputs.name: Robust iterations flag

inputs.description: This attempts to cleanup residual eye and optic nerve voxels which bet2 can sometimes leave behind. This can be useful when running SIENA or SIENAX, for example. Various stages involving standard-space masking, morphpological operations and thresholdings are combined to produce a result which can often give better results than just running bet2.
inputs.name: Residual optic cleanup flag

inputs.description: This attempts to reduce image bias, and residual neck voxels. This can be useful when running SIENA or SIENAX, for example. Various stages involving FAST segmentation-based bias field removal and standard-space masking are combined to produce a result which can often give better results than just running bet2.
inputs.name: Bias reduction flag

inputs.description: This can improve the brain extraction if only a few slices are present in the data (i.e., a small field of view in the Z direction). This is achieved by padding the end slices in both directions, copying the end slices several times, running bet2 and then removing the added slices.
inputs.name: Slice padding flag

inputs.description: This option uses bet2 to determine a brain mask on the basis of the first volume in a 4D data set, and applies this to the whole data set. This is principally intended for use on FMRI data, for example to remove eyeballs. Because it is normally important (in this application) that masking be liberal (ie that there be little risk of cutting out valid brain voxels) the -f threshold is reduced to 0.3, and also the brain mask is "dilated" slightly before being used.
inputs.name: Mask-whole-set flag

inputs.description: This runs both bet2 and betsurf programs in order to get the additional skull and scalp surfaces created by betsurf. This involves registering to standard space in order to allow betsurf to find the standard space masks it needs.
inputs.name: Additional surfaces flag

inputs.description: This is the same as -A except that a T2 image is also input, to further improve the estimated skull and scalp surfaces. As well as carrying out the standard space registration this also registers the T2 to the T1 input image.
inputs.name: Additional surfaces with T2

inputs.description: Switch on diagnostic messages
inputs.name: Verbose Flag

inputs.description: Don't delete temporary intermediate images
inputs.name: Debug Flag
